summary: Allows you to quickly stash excess items into a container and thus save you time while lightening your load. Now with MCM Configuration and user defined lists (Version 3.0).
descriptionHtml:
[center][size=7][color=#0099ff][font=georgia,serif]Quick Stash[/font][/color][/size]
[size=6][size=3]by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/games/users/1012244/?tb=mods]trilioth[/url][/size][/size]
[color=#ffa500][size=4]Requires [url=http://skse.silverlock.org/]SKSE[/url](version 1.6.16 or higher)[/size][/color][/center]

[center][size=6][color=#ff0000][i]It's Here![/i][/color] [size=4]A whole new mod by the maker of Quick Stash[/size], [color=#daa520][size=7][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/54636/?]Quick Sort![/url][/size][/color][/size][/center]
[center]...for those who wish to have an immersive way to quickly sort their items into configurable containers and categories in any player owned home.[/center]
 
Version 2.2 Released. Includes all DLC options with an installer script for FOMOD/NMM. See change log for info on other changes.
Version 3.0 Released. Includes all DLC options with an installer script for FOMOD/NMM and MCM configuration. See Below. Requires a Clean Save due to properties added to the Quick Stash Key.
Version 3.1 Released. Clean Save not required to update. I recommend updating now. See change log.
 
[center][font=verdana,geneva,sans-serif][size=7]Tired of inventory management?[/size][/font]
[font=verdana,geneva,sans-serif][size=5]Would you rather be fighting than stashing your loot?[/size][/font]
[font=verdana,geneva,sans-serif]Are you looking for convenience without feeling like you are cheating?[/font][/center]
 
[center][font=georgia,serif]If you answered yes to any the above,[/font]
[font=georgia,serif][size=5]then [color=#0099ff]Quick Stash[/color] might be right for you[/size].[/font][/center]
 
[color=#afeeee][font=lucida sans unicode,lucida grande,sans-serif][size=5][i]How to do I use it?[/i][/size][/font][/color]
Simply drop the the Quick Stash Key* into any container for quick storage of excess items.
*not an actual key, but can be found with your miscellaneous items. 
 
[color=#afeeee][size=5][font=lucida sans unicode,lucida grande,sans-serif][i]What exactly does it do?[/i][/font][/size][/color] 
Simply put, it's the one-click answer to unloading items.
More precisely, form lists are used for removing a number of items quickly into the container ([color=#ffff00]List 1 Items[/color]),
then your inventory is scanned to remove further items that are not marked as favorite or equipped ([color=#ffff00]List 2 Items[/color]).
After items are removed, then more form lists are used to return any items that should remain in your inventory ([color=#ffff00]List 3 Items[/color]).
Since items of the miscellaneous category are not scanned miscellaneous quest items, gold and lock picks are not removed from your inventory.
 
[color=#ffff00]List 1 Items[/color]:
[LIST]
[*][font=courier new,courier,monospace]All recognized Books[/font] [color=#696969][size=2](excluding known quest items)[/size][/color][/*]
[*][font=courier new,courier,monospace]All Raw Food[/font] [color=#696969][size=2](because you normally eat the prepared food.)[/size][/color][/*]
[*][font=courier new,courier,monospace]All ingredients[/font][size=2] [color=#696969](because you're out hunting treasure not making potions)[/color][/size][/*]
[*][font=courier new,courier,monospace]All crafting materials[/font] [color=#696969][size=2](do you see a tanning rack or forge nearby?)[/size][/color][/*]
[*][font=courier new,courier,monospace]All Soul Gems[/font] [color=#696969][size=2](empty ones will be returned as part of list 3)[/size][/color][/*]
[*][font=courier new,courier,monospace]All Animal Parts[/font][size=2] [color=#696969](because troll skulls are heavy)[/color][/size][/*]
[*][font=courier new,courier,monospace]Miscellaneous Clutter[/font] [color=#696969][size=2](why did you pick up that embalming tool anyway?)[/size][/color][/*]
[*][b][i][s]Coming Soon![/s][/i][/b] [font=courier new,courier,monospace]All of any item you choose[/font] [color=#696969][size=2](excluding player made potions and player made enchanted items.)[/size][/color]Version 3.0[/*]
[/LIST]
[color=#ffff00]List 2 Items[/color]:
[LIST]
[*][font=courier new,courier,monospace]Ammo[/font][/*]
[*][font=courier new,courier,monospace]Armor[/font][/*]
[*][font=courier new,courier,monospace]Potions/Poison/Food[/font][/*]
[*][font=courier new,courier,monospace]Scrolls[/font][/*]
[*][font=courier new,courier,monospace]Weapons[/font][/*]
[/LIST]
[color=#ffff00]List 3 Items[/color]:
[LIST]
[*][font=courier new,courier,monospace]All Known Quest Items[/font][/*]
[*][font=courier new,courier,monospace]Empty Soul Gems[/font][/*]
[*][font=courier new,courier,monospace]All of any item you choose.*[/font] Version 3.0[/*]
[*][font=courier new,courier,monospace]One of each item you choose.*[/font] Version 3.0[/*]
[color=#696969][size=2]* will not work for potions crafted or items enchanted in game.[/size][/color]
[/LIST]
[color=#afeeee][font=lucida sans unicode,lucida grande,sans-serif][size=5][i]Is there more?[/i][/size][/font][/color]
Currently the features described are part of the version 1.0 basic package and does not recognize items from DLC. Future plans in this order:
[LIST]
[*][s][font=courier new,courier,monospace]DLC aware versions[/font] [color=#696969][size=2](Easy peasy. I just wanted to cover Non-DLC version first and not have to rip out DLC content)[/size][/color][/s] Done! Version 2.2[/*]
[*][s][font=courier new,courier,monospace]Basic Configuration for User-Defined List 1 Items.[/font] [color=#696969][size=2](basically you drop the key, which opens a container. Whatever you put into that container goes on the list.)[/size][/color][/s] Skipped in Favor of MCM Menu.[/*]
[*][s][font=courier new,courier,monospace]NMM/FOMOD Installer Script[/font] [color=#696969][size=2](I could use some help with this.)[/size][/color][/s] Done! Version 2.2[/*]
[*][s][font=courier new,courier,monospace]MCM Configuration[/font] [color=#696969][size=2](in the event that prior goals are met and users request more customization)[/size][/color][/s]Done! Version 3.0[/*]
[/LIST]
[color=#afeeee][font=lucida sans unicode,lucida grande,sans-serif][size=5][i]MCM Configuration:[/i][/size][/font][/color]
[LIST]
[*]Made and tested with MCM from SkyUI version 4.1.
[*]Stashing of predefined items,described above, can now be disabled.[/*]
[*]Adds user-defined lists that can also be disabled:
[LIST]
[*]Stash All List[/*]
[*]Keep All List - Returns ALL items in this list after stashing.[/*]
[*]Keep One List - Returns one of each of the items in this list after stashing.[/*]
[/LIST]
[/*]
[/LIST]
The first 128 items in the user-defined lists can be viewed and removed individually. There is also the ability to clear each list.

NOTE: To anyone who wishes to modify the 3 configuration formlist outside the game, you will have to use the MCM Options Menu to clear the list you change for it to display correctly, unless you do so before you use it the first time.

[color=#afeeee][font=lucida sans unicode,lucida grande,sans-serif][size=5][i]Acknowledgements:[/i][/size][/font][/color]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/7831761]krysalynne[/url] - for volunteering for and writing the installer script.
various members of the bethsoft forums - for the input and suggestions given on my thread [url=http://forums.bethsoft.com/topic/1498760-handling-inventory-items/]Handling Inventory Items[/url].
The TES5Edit team - for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25859/?]TES5Edit[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/3900618]matortheeternal[/url] - for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49373/?]Automation Tools for TES5Edit[/url] and for his help in [url=http://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/topic/1038549-automation-tools-for-tes5edit-suggestions-thread/]the forum page[/url].
The [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/3863/?]SkyUI[/url] team - for providing a fantastic UI and the MCM menu system.
And Bethesda - for... You know.
.... 

[center]Disclaimer:
[size=2][i][color=#0099ff]Quick Stash[/color] is not responsible for loss of items due to cell reset on respawning containers or player's inability to access the container at a later time.[/i][/size][/center]
author: trilioth

files.name: Quick Stash - Basic - NON-DLC
files.changelogHtml: Added script files. I forgot to add them originally.

files.name: Quick Stash - Basic - NON-DLC
files.changelogHtml:
Added scripting to make stash aware of NPC carrying capacity.
Dumping into containers handles player made items.
Scripting for NPC awareness handles player made items.
Requires Clean Save if updating from previous version due to additional property of Quick Stash Key.

files.name: Quick Stash - Basic - NON-DLC
files.changelogHtml:
Removed Dragon Heart Scales from the quest form list
Removed Dwemer Cogs from the quest form list
Removed Broken Weapon Pieces from the quest form list (http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Broken_Steel_Sword_Handle#Broken_Steel_Sword_Handle)
Removed Nord War Horn from the quest form list.
Removed Imperial War Horm from the quest form list.
Added Horker Tusk to the crafting materials from list.
If updating from version 2.0, does not require Clean Save.

files.name: Quick Stash - Basic - With Installer for all DLC options
files.fileName: Quick Stash - Basic - With Installer for all DLC options-53103-2-2.7z
files.changelogHtml:
Removed Woodcutter's Axe from Quest List.
Removed Torture Tools from Quest List.
Added Mammoth Tusk Powder to Quest List.
Added Solid Dwemer Metal to Smithing List.
Added Nord War Horn to Clutter list.
Added Imperial War Horn to Clutter list.
Added Dwemer Bowls to Clutter List.
Added Torture Tools to Clutter List.
Added Spigot to Clutter List.
Added ShipOar01 to Clutter List.
Added Horker Tusk to Animal Parts List (It was not actually added to the Crafting Materials list in version 2.1 as stated).

files.name: Quick Stash - MCM - All DLCs Installer
files.fileName: Quick Stash - MCM - All DLCs Installer-53103-3-1.7z
files.changelogHtml:
Made a small change to one script to prevent items without names from being moved.

I discovered that Dual Sheath Redux added items to your inventory that you cannot see, but the script can detect. These items had no name, hence the change.

files.name: Quick Stash - MCM - All DLCs Packed
files.fileName: Quick Stash - MCM - All DLCs Packed-53103-3-1.zip
files.changelogHtml:
Made a small change to one script to prevent items without names from being moved.

I discovered that Dual Sheath Redux added items to your inventory that you cannot see, but the script can detect. These items had no name, hence the change.
